item.title: Blizzard Entertainment dates â€˜next chapterâ€™ reveals for World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Hearthstone, and Diablo
item.content:encoded:
Blizzard Entertainment will showcase â€œwhat comes nextâ€ for World of Warcraft, Overwatch, Hearthstone, and Diablo over the next few weeks, starting January 29 and ending February 11, the developer teased in a 35th anniversary celebration video.

â€œFor 35 years, Blizzard has been shaped by the worlds we build and the players who bring them to life,â€ the studio said. â€œYouâ€™ve fought through World of Warcraft, battled in Diablo, played your cards in Hearthstone, and held the line in Overwatch. Weâ€™ve come a long way together. And now, the next chapter begins.â€

The company continued, â€œOver the next few weeks, each world will showcase what comes next. If these games mean something to you, weâ€™d love to see you there. These arenâ€™t updates in isolation. Theyâ€™re part of where Blizzard is headingâ€”together with the players whoâ€™ve been here all along.â€

Blizzard Entertainment Johanna Faries said, â€œOur extraordinarily talented teams have assembled a stellar line-up for our players across our universes. This major showcase event comes at a significant moment in time as we reflect on three and a half decades of Blizzard history and our big ambitions for the future. This is only the start of what weâ€™ll share around our games this year, and we canâ€™t wait to bring it to life.â€

Here is the full schedule of upcoming reveals:

  • World of Warcraft: State of Azeroth
    • When: January 29 at 9:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET
    • Where: YouTube, Twitch
  • Overwatch Spotlight
    • When: February 4 at 10:00 a.m. PT / 1:00 p.m. ET
    • Where: YouTube, Twitch
  • Hearthstone Spotlight
    • When: February 9 at 9:30 a.m. PT / 12:30 p.m. ET
    • Where: YouTube, Twitch
  • Diablo 30th Anniversary Spotlight
    • When: February 11 at 2:00 p.m. PT / 5:00 p.m. ET
    • Where: YouTube, Twitch

Watch a teaser trailer below.
